msContents.summary: Harp of Praise, አርጋኖነ፡ ውዳሴ፡; Twenty-one Miracles of Mary, ተአምረ፡ ማርያም፡; Prayer to Jesus. “O Lord Jesus Christ, Son of the Living God, for the sake of Mary, your mother, help me.”

msItem.title: Monday
three Miracles of Mary

How the Virgin Mary saved a bandit who was devoted to her, when the people caught him and led him to the gallows; and how he later became a monk (Princeton Ethiopic 41, ff. 80rv; cf. Budge, XXXI; MYS 1, ff. 25rv)

How Sybil, the prophetess, saw a vision of the Virgin Mary holding her child within a circle around the sun and revealed this vision to a king who refused to be worshipped (TM61 241–2; Princeton 8, ff. 6r–8v; Princeton 20, ff. 39r–40r; Princeton 41, ff. 37v–39r; MYS 1, ff. 127rv)

How a certain man slew an evil-living deacon and buried him where he fell and how the Virgin Mary had his body dug up and buried in consecrated ground (Budge, CIII; Princeton Ethiopic 8, ff. 9r–10v; Princeton Ethiopic 41, ff. 80v–81v; Princeton Ethiopic 43, ff. 25r–26r; Princeton Ethiopic 46, ff. 128rv; MYS 1, ff. 85v–86r)
Tuesday
three Miracles of Mary
How the Virgin Mary kept alive a certain wicked man who had been beaten by his enemies until he repented from his sins (Princeton Ethiopic 8, ff. 12v–13v)
How the Virgin Mary received the soul of a certain dissolute man who worshipped her, and took it to Paradise (Cf. Budge, XXVI; Princeton Ethiopic 41, ff. 85v–86v)

How the Virgin Mary received the soul of a certain deacon who addressed the “Five Gaudes” to her at all times, and took it to Paradise (Budge, XXVII; Princeton Ethiopic 41, ff. 84r–85r; MYS 1, ff. 19v–20r)
Wednesday
three Miracles of Mary
How the Virgin Mary saved a young Jew of Tyre from the fiery furnace into which his father had cast him (Budge, XLIV; TM61 209–11; compare with Budge, LIX; Princeton 20, ff. 37r–39r; MYS 1, f. 130v)

How the Virgin Mary protected a woman, great with child, who was overtaken by an inrush of the sea, and how the woman brought forth her child and escaped from drowning (Budge, XXXII; Princeton Ethiopic 41, ff. 83r–84r; MYS 1, ff. 21v–22r)

How two women, went on a pilgrimage to Jerusalem, were attached by robbers who stole their provisions; and how, when the thieves tried to eat them, the Virgin Mary turned the bread into stones upon which the thieves broke their teeth; and how the thieves repented and restored twofold what they had stolen from the women, when the Virgin Mary had healed their wounded mouths and mended their broken teeth (Budge, XI; Princeton Ethiopic 41, ff. 60v–61r; MYS 1, ff. 11rv)
Thursday
three Miracles of Mary

How the Virgin Mary appeared to reassure an ascetic woman about the purity of her friends, other ascetic women in the monastery (Princeton Ethiopic 8, ff. 19v–21r; Princeton Ethiopic 20, ff. 5v–6r, 31r, and 75rv; MYS 1, ff. 82v–83r)

How the Virgin Mary spoke from her picture to a devout worshipper and said to him, “Blessed art thou among men” (Budge, II; Princeton 20, ff. 41v–42r; Princeton 23, ff. 28v–29v; Princeton 41, ff. 54v; Princeton 43, ff. 8rv; Princeton 46, ff. 10v–11r; MYS 1, f. 171v)

How the Virgin Mary delivered from prison a certain man called “George the New” who had been condemned to suffer by the judges, and how she healed the wound in his head which had been inflicted by those who beat him (Budge, XIX; Princeton Ethiopic 41, ff. 67v–68r; MYS 1, ff. 15rv)
Friday
three Miracles of Mary

How the Virgin Mary healed a certain sinful woman when she swallowed a scorpion because she was depressed about her sin and how a voice from the icon led her to a certain priest for repentance and healing; and how she gave birth to forty scorpions when she had completed her repentance (TM61 330–2; Princeton 20, ff. 57rv; MYS 1, f. 169v)

How the Virgin Mary healed an elderly priest when he fell and broke his back during the church service because of his old age (cf. Budge, III, which identifies the location as Alexandria and the man as an elderly Jew of Akəmim; Princeton 20, ff. 42r–43r; Princeton 43, ff. 8v–9v; Princeton 46, ff. 11rv; MYS 1, ff. 171rv)

How the scribe used to write the name of the Virgin Mary in gold and colored paints, and how the Virgin appeared to him when dying, and took his soul to Paradise and showed him his name inscribed upon a pillar of gold (Budge, IV; Princeton Ethiopic 41, ff. 55v–56r; MYS 1, ff. 7rv, some of which identify the man’s name as Damianus)
Saturday
three Miracles of Mary
How the Virgin Mary received the gift of a certain woman who was forbidden to fast by her husband (cf. Budge, XCIX; Princeton 20, ff. 6rv; Princeton 43, ff. 58r–61r; MYS 1, ff. 148v–149r)

How the Virgin Mary saved the drunken monk from a lion and a savage dog (See Budge, XXXVII and XLVIII; cf., Princeton 8, ff. 21r–22r; Princeton 20, ff. 9rv; Princeton 20, ff. 87rv; Princeton 41, ff. 98v–99v; Princeton 43, ff. 15v–17r; MYS 1, f. 148r)
How the Virgin Mary appeared to a wealthy woman at a monastery while the monks were in prayer (Princeton 8, ff. 45v–46v; Princeton 20, ff. 25v–26v; MYS 1, f. 164v)
Sunday
three Miracles of Mary
How Jesus asked Mary about her five lamentations (TM61 161–2; Princeton 46, f. 102v; Princeton 47, ff. 102v–103v; MYS 1, f. 107r)

How the Virgin Mary spoke through an icon to Abba Kiros; how she commanded him to keep the remains of his father; how she made a covenant with him to effect forgiveness for 300 souls each day (this miracle is not in any of the other manuscripts we have studied, nor in Budge)

How the Virgin Mary appeared to priests who were singing in a church; how she gave them a drink from a golden cup; how a monk who wasn’t singing was forbidden by the angel of God to drink; and how he saw how the other priests were singing like the Seraphim, repented of his attitude and began to sing (this miracle is not in any of the other manuscripts we have studied, nor in Budge)

, there appear to have been two original owners whose names have been erased and replaced by a later owner. The original owners’ names were Tǝrsitä Wäld (e.g., ) and Ḫaylä Giyorgis ( and passim). These have been replaced recently with the name Amdä Täklä Haymanot, in blue ink
